intro: Canthium setiflorum subsp. telidosma, commonly known as the slender-headed spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant features upright stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in cyathia, typical of the genus Canthium. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks.
